title: Ebico
author: Ebico
content: I am a newbie. And though I read a lot before registering on the forum, well I still need clarity and detailed explanation on how I can successfully grow in ranks in this forum.I will appreciate your comments especially those that have gone far in ranks in this forum.Thanks, as I anticipate your Swift and favourable response.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Everything you nee to kmow about btge forum ranks, merits and activities are round here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0 I will also encourage you to go through the forum's rules and regulations on this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 lastly i will drop you another blink to read what is expected of you to do before posting https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0 then let this be your take home to known about onnthis forum.1. Don't plagiarize2. Don't post off topics3. Get familiar with the forum and boards4. Read the rules and make sure you understand them5. Make use of the forum search button for any aspect you may like to know6. Be active and keep to learning, don't rush and maintain a dencent modesty (reputation) on the forum.Welcome onboard.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: The first rule is to read the rules of the forum and to make sure you familiarize yourself with the and learn how to stay clear from whatever that will affect your membership here in the forum.Once you master those simple steps, just as mentioned by the first member you commented on this post, don't claim others' work and don't scam once you are creative and active in the forum your activities will grow which shows your level of interaction in the forum.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: You need to read and search before posting. [Guide] Searching effectivelyAs a newbie, please read some important points from admin in the Welcome messageMastering anything needs time, including forum rules to Bitcoin technical terminologies and on chain stuffs. So take your time.You can learn and enjoy your time in a biggest Bitcoin forum without ranking up.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Ebico on June 07, 2023, 11:16:18 AMI am a newbie. And though I read a lot before registering on the forum, well I still need clarity and detailed explanation on how I can successfully grow in ranks in this forum.Honestly, it depends on your caliber to grow. Advancing on ranks here isnt simple, you need to contribute, interact meaningful ideas and topics to be able to receive merits. But thats not gonna happen in a jiffy. Understand the forum rules, collect intellectual ideas about bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Sometimes being humorous is a plus, and you frequently have some nice logical response. But for the meantime, adhere to rules of the forum and focus on dos and dont. This will get you somewhere in the future.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: 348Judah on June 07, 2023, 11:30:33 AM1. Don't plagiarize2. Don't post off topics3. Get familiar with the forum and boards4. Read the rules and make sure you understand them5. Make use of the forum search button for any aspect you may like to know6. Be active and keep to learning, don't rush and maintain a dencent modesty (reputation) on the forum.In addition to what this user just listed above, I will love to add mine as follows;7. Don't generate a post using A.I "especially Chat G.P.T" as it is against the non-written forum rules.8. Don't scam other members on this forum, because you might likely be given a red tag that will damage your account.9. Focus on creating valuable contents and merits will come naturally, please don't beg for merit or do merit trading as it could be harmful to your account.10. Lastly, Always try to study any post you happens to come across which has a lot of merit, and try the know the reason why it got so much merit & try to apply it in your next post. (i.e Maybe the post was educative or it answered a question in a more detailed manner that everybody could understand).

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on June 07, 2023, 01:58:48 PM7. Don't generate a post using A.I "especially Chat G.P.T" as it is against the non-written forum rules.The rule for it is, Plagiarism.Copy and paste AI-generated content without source (I doubt such posters will leave AI sources) is plagiarism. The same for any tool you use to get content but not write it from your mind, by yourself.

comments.author: Liliana1304
comments.body: What I've understood about the way the forum operates is that it's similar to a gadget that gas a manual. Without fully understanding the manual, you can't be able to enjoy what you have.  The forum is a fun place to be but it may look boring when you feel you're contributing but it's not reflecting because you're not getting the merits. I just know that when you contribute intelligently, you'd get the merits that would push up your ranks since it's not only when your activities grow.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Ebico on June 07, 2023, 11:16:18 AMI am a newbie. And though I read a lot before registering on the forum, well I still need clarity and detailed explanation on how I can successfully grow in ranks in this forum.I will appreciate your comments especially those that have gone far in ranks in this forum.Thanks, as I anticipate your Swift and favourable response.To grow in ranks in this forum. Here are a few things I have learned over the years of being here:- If you take your time to read and learn about bitcoin and the cryptocurrency world, you will be able to make meaningful contributions to the conversations that goes on here. If you do, some members may show acknowledgement and appreciation by sending you merits.- You do not have to comment on every topic you don't have anything to write. You would be considered a spammer if you do so.- Take the time to go through the posting and writing patterns of higher ranking members on the forum to understand their writing style, research ability, and from there, develop yours.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: To grow your rank you need merits and activity, the former is the harder because you need to earn it while the activity points will keep increasing as long as you're active here.So how to get merits is the point you need to know and the most generic answer is "post quality posts", it can be a one liner or a detailed explanation about the topic which depends. You can also monitor the highest merit earners to get an idea how they are doing it.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: To grow in rank is basically to post quality stuff that other users (and MS's) would like and find merit-worthy. The thing is you must earn merits from others, thus you might be a high quality poster, but the boards you frequent is different from where the users with the most merits visits, and in that case you might stay a long time before being noticed.If you post naturally and learn at your own pace, you'd prolly rank up; but the speed at which you rank up depends on the knowledge you have at your disposal, this is the reason why certain users would definitely rank up quicker than others, so just be yourself and grow at your own speed.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: It’s no longer surprising to me that newbies know about merit and are much interested in increasing their merit number because most claim to have been lurking around the forum before registering an account. If you have been reading a lot as you say, you should have found threads where this topic have been discussed.The only way to get merits is to engage topics and make on-topic contributions to the discussion. Do not plagiarize and avoid making off-topic comments.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum. But I also want to know how you know about the forum. Who introduced the forum to you. If you introduced to the forum by someone, it would be better you meet the person for proper guidance on this basic aspect or things in the forum. Well you can still learn from the forum. Continue reading and ask questions. To rank up in the forum. There are two things you need to have. Activities and Merits. And you can get that from here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Quote from: SatoPrincess on June 07, 2023, 06:37:38 PMIt’s no longer surprising to me that newbies know about merit and are much interested in increasing their merit number because most claim to have been lurking around the forum before registering an account. If you have been reading a lot as you say, you should have found threads where this topic have been discussed.The only way to get merits is to engage topics and make on-topic contributions to the discussion. Do not plagiarize and avoid making off-topic comments. But there are also many beginners who eventually give up because they don't get any merit at all because their contributions are lacking and don't provide responses that are appropriate to the topics discussed.To be able to get merit depends on how we contribute, if it is useful for the forum then it will be easy to do. and plagiarism is also found a lot and comes from newbies and in the end they will be ignored.

comments.author: BD Crypto
comments.body: Quote from: Ebico on June 07, 2023, 11:16:18 AMI am a newbie. And though I read a lot before registering on the forum, well I still need clarity and detailed explanation on how I can successfully grow in ranks in this forum.As I see you are a newbie, Welcome to this Forum. Firstly this forum is a place where you can discuss about crypto, can learn and can help others by providing information or anything. So if you do it on a right way I mean by maintaining forum rules you may rank up your account very soon. But you must have patience because at the first time it looks quite hard to rank up but if your posts are helpful and meaningful and not a off topic then you may grow faster. Always keep leaning and share your thoughts, experiencs and help others.  Don't Rush on gaining merits, try to contribute in this Forum. Also be active in your local board. At I wish you all the best for your forum journey.

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: How to grow rank on this forum.1.  Follow the forum's rules and always read to understand the discussion of a topic before jumping into the discussion.2. Create high-quality content like tutorials or articles that will solve other forum member issues.3.  Follow the forum's rules and always read to understand the discussion of a topic before jumping into the discussion.Remember that it takes time and effort to establish a reputation and advance in rank on Bitcointalk. Be sure to exercise patience, participate in worthwhile dialogues, and adhere to best practices.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: Quote from: SatoPrincess on June 07, 2023, 06:37:38 PMIt’s no longer surprising to me that newbies know about merit and are much interested in increasing their merit number because most claim to have been lurking around the forum before registering an account. There is nothing wrong if a newbie come to ask forum users on such question even as they may have the knowledge from people that introduced them here. You should understand you have been in that shoes before now and no need to criticize them a lot Asking is perhaps to get a confirmation from other users and also to try their luck to be merited on their thread. Nobody likes to stay stagnant in a place, everyone strive to be at the top and that is what newbies try to do and if they don't succeed, then they give up. They need some level of encouragement.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: To grow in rank you need to put effort into the forum, the forum operates like anything out there, you get back what you give in. It's perfectly alright for one to just want to understand how the forum works and learn from threads when they have an issue, but if you want to earn merits and rank up you need to put in effort to join discussions, do research on topics, try to be active as regularly as possible.It's difficult when you're starting out but I can guarantee that it gets easier with time. Good luck!

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on June 07, 2023, 12:30:30 PMThe first rule is to read the rules of the forum and to make sure you familiarize yourself with the and learn how to stay clear from whatever that will affect your membership here in the forum.Once you master those simple steps, just as mentioned by the first member you commented on this post, don't claim others' work and don't scam once you are creative and active in the forum your activities will grow which shows your level of interaction in the forum. Just abide with the rules and keep active on the forum, that way you will level up your rank provided that you also keep on posting quality posts that can be valuable for other members. Although you can easily increase your rank once you reach enough number of post activity, but it will be more meaningful if those posts too can give benefits to other members especially newbies. And never spam or resort into plagiarizing, that will put your account into danger. And lastly, respect everyone in the forum regardless of its position, you will earn merits from that.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: You have learned a lot before creating an account here in this forum so I suppose you also know that don't create useless topics. Newbies like you wanted to see success right after they started doing what they were supposed to do. I have seen someone accusing the system for not getting merit and rank in the forum but before that accusing thread he had posted only 5 times from his account. So be patient, read and spend time here you will find your way up.
